title: Meade Island
text:
Meade Island is an uninhabited sand island located about 200 metres from <a href="Dirk%20Hartog%20Island">Dirk Hartog Island</a> in the <a href="Shark%20Bay%2C%20Western%20Australia">Shark Bay World Heritage Site</a> in <a href="Western%20Australia">Western Australia</a>, and joined to that island at low tide. It has an area of about 800 square metres (0.2 acre), and an elevation of two metres (7 ft).
The island's vegetation is a closed <a href="heath%20%28habitat%29">heath</a>, of which the dominant plant species are "<a href="Nitraria%20billardierei">Nitraria billardierei</a>" (Nitre Bush), "<a href="Scaevola%20%20crassifolia">Scaevola crassifolia</a>" (Thick-leaved Fan-flower) and "<a href="Spinifex%20longifolius">Spinifex longifolius</a>" (Beach Spinifex). Other plant species include "<a href="Exocarpos%20aphyllus">Exocarpos aphyllus</a>" (Leafless Ballart), <a href="Rhagodia%20preissii%20subsp.%20obovata">"Rhagodia preissii" subsp. "obovata"</a>, "<a href="Salsola%20%20tragus">Salsola tragus</a>" (Prickly Saltwort), "<a href="Sonchus%20oleraceus">Sonchus oleraceus</a>" (Common Sow-thistle), and a species of "<a href="Pelargonium">Pelargonium</a>". Eight species of <a href="seabird">seabird</a> roost on the island.
